==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=荸荠鼓|type=21}}

===Etymology===
[[荸薺]] (water chestnut) + [[鼓]] (drum), so called because it looks like a water chestnut with its top and bottom cut off

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=bíqígǔ
|cat=n
}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# A small, shallow double-headed drum with a high pitch, played with a single stick held by the right hand, usually in conjunction with a [[paiban]] held in the left hand; formerly used in traditional musics of the [[Jiangnan]] region

====Synonyms====
* {{zh-l|點鼓}}
* {{zh-l|懷鼓}}
